channel.title: Need help with the "!=somehing here" (e.x != null )
channel.description:
No, this is not spam.
my question:
what does
[code]if(person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")[/code] mean? (does it mean if the player name IS null.. or if its NOT null? (im guessing its sayin the player name is not null right?)
basically want to know what does "!= something here" means...

item.title: Need help with the "!=somehing here" (e.x != null )
item.dc:creator: @adam2348 adam2348
item.description:
@adam2348 wrote:

omg…what the dude is asking is, what does the operator != mean

!= means does not equal

null is like 0 but not, it’s like “null and void” it’s nothing, like not set yet. 0 is set, null is not.[br][size=1]Posted at: December 03, 2006, 08:44:50 PM[/size][hr]and what that code is doing, is like checking to be sure that playername is a real playername, and then does whatever u tell it to do, like this is a way to do a for-loop and go thru all player slots to do something to that player, but if that slot is empty it will be null, and not do it

sorry if that confused u

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with the "!=somehing here" (e.x != null )
